intro: Achillea × nitida, commonly known as the silver yarrow, is a hybrid perennial plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which bloom from early summer to autumn. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its aromatic leaves and ornamental value make it a valued addition to both garden and landscape design.
